alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:06AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mason, Cabell, northwestern Kanawha, Putnam, Lincoln and northeastern Wayne Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1206 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milton, or 12 miles north of Hamlin, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, Hamlin, Beech Fork State Park, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Sissonville, Milton, Eleanor, Buffalo, Poca, Ona, Culloden, Spurlockville and Institute. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 111 and 117. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 18 and 54. Route 119 between mile markers 63 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for central, western and northwestern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam; Wayne
